description: From a Northern England dialectal variant of gnatter (also knatter) ("to chatter, grumble; nibble away at"), ultimately of imitative origin. Cognate with German Low German gnattern (“to mumble, grumble, be grouchy”).

verbs.description: natter (third-person singular simple present natters, present participle nattering, simple past and past participle nattered)

entries.meaning: (colloquial) To talk casually; to discuss unimportant matters.
examples: What are you guys nattering about? You're clearly not following the meeting!
